question_text: What are software conflicts in motherboard troubleshooting and how do they manifest?
answer_options: Software conflicts only occur between user applications and don't affect hardware
Driver conflicts, service conflicts, hardware resource conflicts causing instability and crashes
All software conflicts indicate physical hardware damage to motherboard
Software conflicts exclusively affect network connectivity and nothing else
correct_answer: Driver conflicts, service conflicts, hardware resource conflicts causing instability and crashes
explanation: Software conflicts affecting motherboards: driver conflicts between different hardware manufacturers, service conflicts from multiple hardware management utilities, resource conflicts (IRQ, DMA, I/O addresses), and compatibility issues between BIOS settings and OS. Symptoms: random crashes, BSOD, device failures, and system instability. Resolution requires systematic driver management and conflict resolution.
